audios.au: The unloading level is a special reference level, advantageous for loading and unloading, and is specified via parameterizing, as a certain difference to driving level I.

On dump vehicles the unloading level can be automatically achieved, triggered bei the raising of the dump. When lowering the superstructure, hard bumping after quick discharging of the load is prevented and the stops are protected.
Otherwise the unloading level is manually addressed, for instance using an unloading level switch.
